TopicTitle: A Well Thought of Easter Egg: One that has been in front of you every time you play!

Articles.Content:
The color of the Kerbals' skin is close to is #BADA55|\\|| <--- This Color in hexadecimal color.

I was just looking around the wiki and saw this.

While this may not be the exact hexadecimal color, it is still very close. It would be even more of a coincidence if Squad didn't intend on this.

Can a Squad employee confirm whether this was intended or not?

Edited January 15, 2015 by michaelsteele3
That is fantastic. I want to believe.
I do believe this was posted in the threads some considerable time ago.
Yeah, this was being talked about the first time I played the game (almost 2 years ago, with 0.19). And even then, KSP vets were poking fun at the newb's for pointing it out.

Yeah, this was being talked about the first time I played the game (almost 2 years ago, with 0.19). And even then, KSP vets were poking fun at the newb's for pointing it out.

If the last part of your post was aimed at me, I wasn't poking fun at anyone, just stating a fact. If I had wanted to be negative, I would have suggested the OP did a search before posting such old news.

Fun fact: While not an official site by SQUAD, Kerbal Stuff's header is 186, 216, 85, the exact RGB representation of #BADA55.

While SQUAD might not of made it intentional, there's no mistake Kerbal Stuff did.

Picture with relevant portions prioritized (using 30 seconds in MS paint, because it loads marginally faster than GIMP)

EDIT: And today, I learned that I am not an artist.
i joined around .18 and i dont remember ever seeing a discussion about this.

I use it for my KSP filmstrips in my signature.

{

position:absolute;

left:15px;

background-color:#bada55;

vertical-align:middle;

}

Old topic. This is a coincidence (unless SQUAD has been hiding it all these years) - anyone with experience in hexadecimal or typing messages in their calculator (did you know that 0.7734 spells "hello" upside-down?) can guess that pretty near any color has a similar color that can be expressed as some cool secret word, so the fact that SQUAD was lucky enough to pick one of the thousands of colors that's similar to #BADA55 isn't terribly shocking.

...Sorry, it's my nature to burst people's bubbles mercilessly. xD

BTW Badlands close to #bada55 too

Yeah, green is pretty close to green, I give you that.

Dont mean to burst bubbles, but yeah... I dont think its intended

I think Ive seen a thread like this a long time ago.
